title.narrative: The Pacific Australia Climate Change Science and Adaptation Planning Program

description.narrative: The Pacific Australia Climate Change Science and Adaptation Planning Program (PACCSAPP) forms part of the International Climate Change Adaptation Initiative. It is managed by Australia's Department of Climate Change and Energy Efficiency and brings together two previous programs: the Pacific Climate Change Science Program; and the Pacific Adaptation Strategy Assistance Program. The expected outcomes include: capacity of National Meteorological Services to use climate science is developed; awareness-raising materials linking country specific climate projections and key adaption planning information are synthesised and communicated to key Pacific stakeholders and development partners; effects of climate change on climate variability and extreme events are better understood; and adaption planning and decision making is informed by improved understanding of climate science and the social and economic dimensions of adaption. The total value of this multi-country initiative is $32.1 million
